## Description {#details}

An abstract interface for all nocapture attributes.

Definition at line 4356 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Enumerations

### anonymous enum  {#a0b4fb5399b000ba05e553a4d96305964}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="anonymous enum ">
State encoding bits.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a0b4fb5399b000ba05e553a4d96305964a886cd7d160324cd20be6c43de7d24d93" />
<EnumerationListItem name="NOT_CAPTURED_IN_MEM">
 (= 1 &lt;&lt; 0)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0b4fb5399b000ba05e553a4d96305964a61acb0318e67130328c895c9cc404220" />
<EnumerationListItem name="NOT_CAPTURED_IN_INT">
 (= 1 &lt;&lt; 1)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0b4fb5399b000ba05e553a4d96305964a23b11d729b9274a206bf4e7a3e51482e" />
<EnumerationListItem name="NOT_CAPTURED_IN_RET">
 (= 1 &lt;&lt; 2)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0b4fb5399b000ba05e553a4d96305964a4f93ae6fded858c376d12d0d3e3a27e8" />
<EnumerationListItem name="NO_CAPTURE_MAYBE_RETURNED">
If we do not capture the value in memory or through integers we can only communicate it back as a derived pointer (= NOT&#95;CAPTURED&#95;IN&#95;MEM | NOT&#95;CAPTURED&#95;IN&#95;INT)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0b4fb5399b000ba05e553a4d96305964a8464120a9bdc56bba45e3f099b783e93" />
<EnumerationListItem name="NO_CAPTURE">
If we do not capture the value in memory, through integers, or as a derived pointer we know it is not captured (=
        NOT&#95;CAPTURED&#95;IN&#95;MEM | NOT&#95;CAPTURED&#95;IN&#95;INT | NOT&#95;CAPTURED&#95;IN&#95;RET)
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

A set bit in the state means the property holds. NO&#95;CAPTURE is the best possible state, 0 the worst possible state.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l04383">4383</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### determineFunctionCaptureCapabilities() {#af9efb4b2e9c757aaa9d2fada609eaee8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void AANoCapture::determineFunctionCaptureCapabilities (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irposition">IRPosition</a> &amp; IRP, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bitintegerstate">BitIntegerState</a> &amp; State)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Update <code>State</code> according to the capture capabilities of <code>F</code> for position <code>IRP</code>.

Set the NOT&#95;CAPTURED&#95;IN&#95;MEM and NOT&#95;CAPTURED&#95;IN&#95;RET bits in <code>Known</code> depending on the ability of the function associated with <code>IRP</code> to capture state in memory and through &quot;returning/throwing&quot;, respectively.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l04370">4370</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/attributorattributes-cpp/#l05776">5776</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/attributorattributes-cpp">AttributorAttributes.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
